notes.title: Constitution Feature Overview
notes.content: The constitution feature ensures all generated artifacts adhere to organizational standards and best practices. It acts as a quality gate throughout the workflow.
tips: Explain that constitutions are customizable per organization
Mention that principles can be added or modified
Highlight that checks can be extended with custom validators

notes.title: Constitution Principles
notes.content: Each principle represents a key organizational standard. Principles are grouped by category: security, quality, performance, and maintainability.
tips: Expand each principle to show details
Show how principles map to checks

notes.title: Workflow Engine Overview
notes.content: The workflow engine orchestrates the entire specification-to-implementation journey. It maintains state, validates transitions, and triggers appropriate actions at each phase.
tips: Mention that phases can be revisited
Highlight the artifact generation at each step

notes.title: Artifact Generation
notes.content: Each phase generates specific artifacts: spec.md, plan.md, and tasks.md. These documents are interconnected and maintain traceability.
tips: Show the markdown rendering in the viewer

notes.title: Custom Scenario Creation
notes.content: The custom scenario feature allows presenters to tailor demos to specific audiences. Create scenarios that match the industry or use case of your audience.
tips: Mention that custom scenarios persist locally

notes.title: Demo Reset Feature
notes.content: The reset feature allows quick restoration of the demo to its initial state. Use this between demo sessions or to show the workflow from the beginning.
tips: Mention that custom scenarios are preserved
Point out the clean state confirmation
